Line0.name: Fifi
Line0.dialogue: My school is the only one that isn't off because of the cuarintine

Line1.name: Fifi
Line1.dialogue: Screw them, there are already over a hundred dead in my state alone. i don't want to be a fucking statistic.

Line2.name: Fifi
Line2.dialogue: But i'll probably lose some classes

Line3.name: Fifi
Line3.dialogue: i just need to take my mind off these things, i'll go with old man Old Snowball, he always clears my mind up

Line9.name: Old Snowball
Line9.dialogue: well hello Fifi, What brings you here so early, usually you don't come till late in the evening

Line10.name: Fifi
Line10.dialogue: I didn't feel up for school today

Line11.name: Fifi
Line11.dialogue: i wanted to finally hear the story about how you met your baby here

Line12.name: Old Snowball
Line12.dialogue: Aye, this old train has watched over me well

Line13.name: Old Snowball
Line13.dialogue: Okay, here goes the story, but it puts me sentimental, so listen closely the first time

Line0.name: Machinist
Line0.dialogue: What do you want?

Option0.Head: Isn't the train supposed to be on by now?

Option1.Head: I used to be a Machinist

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: Isn't the train supposed to be on by now?

Line1.name: Machinist
Line1.dialogue: I was just checking on the passengers, we'll be out shortly

Option1.Head: I used to be a machinist

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: I used to be a machinist myself

Line1.name: Machinist
Line1.dialogue: Used to? Now what do you do?

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: I'm on my way to make a new railway, maybe your train will ride it

Line3.name: Machinist
Line3.dialogue: This here train is on it's last voyage, after this it's off to the scrapyard

Line4.name: Machinist
Line4.dialogue: This here train is on it's last voyage, after this it's off to the scrapyard

Line6.name: Machinist
Line6.dialogue: sometimes a young guy gets on the train, or hitchs a ride, and they need a job, or they're running from something, or maybe they're lost and just give up, in the force we call them easy fallers

Line7.name: Machinist
Line7.dialogue: sometimes a young guy gets on the train, or hitchs a ride, and they need a job, or they're running from something, or maybe they're lost and just give up, in the force we call them easy fallers

Option1.Head: How does one get a job like this?

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: That sounds horrible!

Line1.name: Machinist
Line1.dialogue: Yep, but you can change jobs after a while, i was a brakeman for decades before i became a machinist

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: You where an easy faller?, what happened?

Line3.name: Machinist
Line3.dialogue: I liked trains, one day I got lost on a train without my mom when I was a young boy

Line4.name: Machinist
Line4.dialogue: When the train finally got to central station they just gave me an uniform and told me I was theirs

Line5.name: Snowball
Line5.dialogue: Your poor mother, she must have been devestaded

Line6.name: Machinist
Line6.dialogue: Either they told her i was dead, or she was happy she had one less mouth to feed, because i haven't seen her since

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: How does one get a job like this?

Line3.name: Machinist
Line3.dialogue: I liked trains, one day I got lost on a train without my mom when I was a young boy

Line4.name: Machinist
Line4.dialogue: When the train finally got to central station they just gave me an uniform and told me I was theirs

Line5.name: Snowball
Line5.dialogue: Did your mother just not care

Line6.name: Machinist
Line6.dialogue: Either they told her I was dead, or she was happy she had one less mouth to feed, because I haven't seen her since

Line0.name: Machinist
Line0.dialogue: what now?

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: I took a child with a writer on board

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: to listen to some stories since he was a bit sad

Line7.name: Machinist
Line7.dialogue: Well you should get going, it's not safe over here

Line0.name: Machinist
Line0.dialogue: What are you doing here?

Line3.name: Snowball
Line3.dialogue: We've lost him and I said I would be responsible for his safety

Line4.name: Machinist
Line4.dialogue: Well I haven't seen him pass through here, you should check the roof

Line5.name: Machinist
Line5.dialogue: Maybe he went up trying to see what his dad did

Line0.name: Machinist
Line0.dialogue: I'm surprised you didn't die on the roof

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: You disgusting sick degenerate piece of sub-feline filth

Option0.Head: is the boy just another prospective worker for you?

Line0.name: Machinist
Line0.dialogue: The boy?

Line2.name: Machinist
Line2.dialogue: He was running around on the roof wanting to die like his father

Line3.name: Machinist
Line3.dialogue: I brought him down, i saved his life, a life that would have been lost

Line4.name: Machinist
Line4.dialogue: Now he's mine, and the companys to use as we see fit

Line5.name: Snowball
Line5.dialogue: You sick freak, where is he

Line6.name: Machinist
Line6.dialogue: Shoveling coal in the engine room, getting used to his new life

Line7.name: Snowball
Line7.dialogue: You bastard, tell me where he is or I will punch the truth out of you!

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: This train sure is taking it's time isn't it?

Option0.Head: I imagine the train has it's reasons

Option1.Head: It ireally is, it's quite strange

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: someone should go see if the machinist isn't sleeping

Line3.name: Widow
Line3.dialogue: On my way to the central station, going to cash some money my husbands owed, pay rent, pay my sons college

Line4.name: Widow
Line4.dialogue: Maybe get some new shoes with it

Line5.name: Snowball
Line5.dialogue: He worked for the company then?

Line6.name: Widow
Line6.dialogue: On this very train, he was a brakeman for 35 years

Option0.Head: Why didn't he ever switch jobs?

Option1.Head: He must've had a death wish, or is a really brave man

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: He didn't want anybody else to risk life and limb like that

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: He is an extremely brave man

Option0.Head: And what are you doing in this first class seating?

Option1.Head: Your son said something about hist father

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: On my way to the central station, going to cash some money my husbands owed, pay rent, pay my sons college

Line1.name: Widow
Line1.dialogue: Maybe get some new shoes with it

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: He worked for the company then?

Line3.name: Widow
Line3.dialogue: On this very train, he was a brakeman for 35 years

Option0.Head: Why didn't he ever switch jobs?

Option1.Head: He must've had a death wish, or is a really brave man

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: He didn't want anybody else to risk life and limb like that

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: He is an extremely brave man

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: A couple months back he was working a night shift, and there was a storm..

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: You don't have to go on, I'm terribly sorry for your lost, he sounds like he was a good man

Line4.name: Widow
Line4.dialogue: He never cashed that debt with us in mind

Line4.name: Widow
Line4.dialogue: He wanted to leave something behind in case anything ever happend to him

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: Hello kind man

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: I was just talking with a childrens book writer that's onboard

Line3.name: Snowball
Line3.dialogue: And well, i thought that maybe it'd cheer up your son to be told a story

Line5.name: Widn
Line5.dialogue: I'll consider him in good hands if you watch over him

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: How is my little boy doing?

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: Can you tell my son to hurry up?

Line2.name: Widow
Line2.dialogue: It's about time he get's back, or at least tells me how he's doing

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: So when is he coming back, i'm starting to get nervous

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: But don't panic, i'll find him and bring him here safe and sound, the train isn't that large after all

Line2.name: Widow
Line2.dialogue: By the grace of God if something happens to him i'll smite you down where you stand

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: Oh, he's just having a grand ol' time over there, that guy is a master, the best of the best at what he does I assure you

Line1.name: Widow
Line1.dialogue: Really? Oh my, I'll go have a look right now!

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: Haha, yeah, maybe later i'll take you, but let the kid have fun

Line3.name: Widow
Line3.dialogue: I'd very much like that, and your right, i'm just nervous is all

Line4.name: Snowball
Line4.dialogue: Haha, yeah, nervous, well, I'm off, gotta do... other stuff around, I'm off, bye!

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: Hes getting a tour of the train, you know how much he likes trains

Line2.name: Widow
Line2.dialogue: Well he hasn't passed through here yet, tell him to give a looksie down here, say hello to mama

Line3.name: Snowball
Line3.dialogue: Of course, of course (i HAVE to find him)

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: You aren't completely incompetent

Line1.name: Widow
Line1.dialogue: Thank you very much for finding my son

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: So, what were you up to? I was worried

Line4.name: Child
Line4.dialogue: He has been really nice to me, mama

Line8.name: Widow
Line8.dialogue: Kind man, you are quite good with children

Line9.name: Snowball
Line9.dialogue: I'll at the very least try very hard
